name: Vanuatu
description: Vanuatu, also known as New Hebrides until 1999, is a volcanic archipelago nation in the South Pacific Ocean. It’s comprised of 83 islands, of which 61 are inhabited. The country boasts incredible biodiversity, stunning landscapes ranging from active volcanoes and lush rainforests to pristine beaches and coral reefs, and a rich cultural heritage shaped by Melanesian traditions. Vanuatu is a developing nation with a strong focus on sustainable tourism and preserving its natural resources.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city and economic hub of Vanuatu.
quickFacts.detail: Located on Efate Island, Port Vila offers a vibrant mix of modern amenities and traditional Melanesian culture.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population spread across numerous islands.
quickFacts.detail: The population is predominantly Melanesian, with significant influences from Polynesian and European cultures.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Three official languages reflect Vanuatu’s colonial history.
quickFacts.detail: Bislama is the national language, widely spoken and used in daily life. English is used in education and business, while French is spoken in parts of the country.

quickFacts.label: GDP (2023)
quickFacts.description: A developing economy reliant on agriculture, tourism, and fisheries.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism is a major contributor to the economy, attracting visitors with its pristine beaches and unique cultural experiences.

climateData.title: Climate of Vanuatu
climateData.description: Vanuatu experiences a tropical maritime climate, characterized by high humidity and rainfall throughout the year. The islands are influenced by both the warm trade winds and the cooler currents of the South Pacific.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is generally sunny and pleasant, with lower humidity and less rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings frequent rainfall, particularly in the afternoons, and higher humidity. However, the rain is often short-lived, and sunshine is still abundant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Cyclone Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Vanuatu is susceptible to cyclones during this period, so travelers should be aware of the potential for disruptions.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Yasur
naturalWonders.description: Mount Yasur, located on Tanna Island, is one of the world’s most accessible active volcanoes. Visitors can witness spectacular eruptions from designated viewing platforms.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The volcano’s eruptions are a mesmerizing display of molten lava, ash, and steam, creating a dramatic and unforgettable experience. The surrounding rainforest is teeming with unique flora and fauna.

scientificData.EruptionFrequency: Frequent, with multiple eruptions per day

naturalWonders.name: Hovering Island (Island Ifi)
naturalWonders.description: The Hovering Island is a unique sand formation that appears to ‘hover’ just above the ocean at low tide, creating a surreal and captivating spectacle.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This natural phenomenon is caused by a combination of tidal forces and the island’s porous sand structure. It’s a truly remarkable sight and a popular destination for photographers.
viewingTips: Arrive early to secure a good viewing spot

naturalWonders.name: Hideaway Island
naturalWonders.description: Hideaway Island is a stunning coral atoll offering pristine beaches, turquoise waters, and vibrant coral reefs, making it a paradise for divers and snorkelers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island is surrounded by a barrier reef, protecting it from strong waves and creating a calm and sheltered lagoon. It’s a haven for marine life and a popular destination for eco-tourism.

scientificData.CoralType: Diverse coral species, including staghorn and brain corals

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Vanuatu
ecosystemData.overview: Vanuatu’s diverse islands support a wide range of ecosystems, including rainforests, coral reefs, mangroves, and volcanic landscapes. These ecosystems are home to a remarkable array of plant and animal life, much of which is endemic to the region.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Vanuatu’s land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coral Reefs
biodiversityCategories.description: Vanuatu’s coral reefs are among the most diverse and pristine in the world, supporting a vast array of marine life.

statistics.details: A significant proportion of these are found nowhere else on Earth.

notableSpecies.name: Clownfish
notableSpecies.significance: A flagship species for coral reef conservation.

notableSpecies.name: Manta Ray
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic and ecologically important marine animal.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforests
biodiversityCategories.description: Vanuatu’s rainforests are incredibly rich in biodiversity, harboring a vast array of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: Many are endemic to the islands.

notableSpecies.name: Vanuatu Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered parrot species found only in Vanuatu.

notableSpecies.name: Giant Flying Fox
notableSpecies.significance: A large fruit bat that plays a vital role in rainforest pollination.

activities.title: Activities in Vanuatu
activities.description: Vanuatu offers a diverse range of activities for travelers of all interests, from adventure tourism to cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Vanuatu’s stunning rainforests and volcanic landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Mount Teme Plateau Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike through the rainforest to a plateau with panoramic views.

activities.name: Cascade Trail
activities.description: A gentle walk through lush rainforest to a series of cascading waterfalls.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities in Vanuatu’s crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore vibrant coral reefs and encounter diverse marine life.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Discover the beauty of the coral reefs without diving.

clothing.winter: Long-sleeved shirts, light jacket, rain gear
clothing.yearRound: Versatile clothing suitable for warm and humid conditions

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle
